title: 835-D
statement: D. Palindromic characteristicstime limit per test3 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputPalindromic characteristics of stringswith length|s|is a sequence of|s|integers, wherek-th number is the total number of non-empty substrings ofswhich arek-palindromes.A string is1-palindrome if and only if it reads the same backward as forward.A string isk-palindrome (k> 1) if and only if:Its left half equals to its right half.Its left and right halfs are non-empty (k- 1)-palindromes.The left half of stringtis its prefix of length⌊|t| / 2⌋, and right half — the suffix of the same length.⌊|t| / 2⌋denotes the length of stringtdivided by2, rounded down.Note that each substring is counted as many times as it appears in the string. For example, in the string "aaa" the substring "a" appears 3 times.InputThe first line contains the strings(1 ≤ |s| ≤ 5000) consisting of lowercase English letters.OutputPrint|s|integers — palindromic characteristics of strings.ExamplesInputabbaOutput6 1 0 0InputabacabaOutput12 4 1 0 0 0 0NoteIn the first example 1-palindromes are substring «a», «b», «b», «a», «bb», «abba», the substring «bb» is 2-palindrome. There are no 3- and 4-palindromes here.

processed.result:
You are given a string of lowercase English letters.  

Your task is to determine the number of palindromic substrings of the string for each possible length.

* A 1-palindrome is a substring that reads the same backward as forward (e.g., "a", "aba").
* A k-palindrome ($k > 1$) is a substring that:
    * Has a left half and a right half of equal length.
    * Both the left and right halves are (k-1)-palindromes.

For example, for the string "abba":

* There are 6 1-palindromes: "a", "b", "b", "a", "bb", "abba".
* There is 1 2-palindrome: "bb".
* There are no 3- or 4-palindromes.

Output the number of palindromes of each length from 1 to the length of the string.

Given a string, count how many substrings of it are palindromes of length 1, 2, 3, ..., the length of the string.  A palindrome reads the same backward as forward.  A 2-palindrome has two equal halves, and each half is a 1-palindrome.  A 3-palindrome has three equal parts, and each part is a 2-palindrome, and so on.
